name: Mobile file system extraction
description: Using privileged access to a device (rooted/jailbroken), accessing the file system(s) of the device and extracting a set of files
details: Note that Fukami et al (2021) states "In order to conduct effective file system extraction, rooting the device is required." See T1040. Usually results in a zip/tar file.
references: Cellebrite (undated), Full File System Extraction - Mobile Device Forensics, https://cellebrite.com/en/glossary/full-file-system-extraction-mobile-device-forensics/
Fukami, A., Stoykova, R. and Geradts, Z., 2021. A new model for forensic data extraction from encrypted mobile devices. Forensic Science International: Digital Investigation, 38, p.301169.
Magnet (2024) Revealing hidden data: Full file system extractions uncovered, https://www.magnetforensics.com/blog/revealing-hidden-data-full-file-system-extractions-uncovered/
